public class MacroMolecule.Polymer.BondIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface

Iterates all bonds of the pylomer.

MacroMolecule.Polymer.BondIterator

public MacroMolecule.Polymer.BondIterator()
Creates a new iterator that can return all bonds in the polymer except those that connect hydrogen atoms.

MacroMolecule.Polymer.BondIterator

public MacroMolecule.Polymer.BondIterator(boolean includeH)
Creates a new iterator that can return all bonds in the polymer.

Parameters:
includeH - are hydrogen atom enumerated or not

reset

public void reset()
Initializes the iterator.

Specified by:

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Checks if there are more bonds to enumerate.

Specified by:
hasNext in interface MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface
Returns:
true if there is at least one more bond that has not yet been enumerated

next

public void next()
Skips to next bond. This has no effect if hasNext() returned false. As multiple propreties correspond to the current bond no value (such as bond index etc.) is returned by this method.

Specified by:
next in interface MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface

getSecondaryStructureType

public int getSecondaryStructureType(int whichAtom)
Description copied from interface: MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface
Gets the type of the secondary structure element which the current bond belongs to. This method makes sense for MacroMolecule.Protein bonds only. It is declared here in order to support higher level polymorphism.

Specified by:
getSecondaryStructureType in interface MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface
Returns:
predefined constants see chemaxon.marvin.modules.MacroMolecule.Protein.AtomIterator.SECONDARY_HELIX etc.

public int getAtomType(int whichAtom)
Gets the type of the specified atom of the current bond.

Parameters:
whichAtom - ATOM1 or ATOM2 or NEIGHBOR
Returns:
type of the atom at the given end of the bond

getX

public float getX(int whichAtom)
Gets the first coordinate of the atom at the specified end of the current bond. An undefined neighbor can also be queried (when the given parameter value is NEIGHBOR). This neighbouring atom is connected to either end of the bond. This is needed for 3D drawing.

Specified by:
getX in interface MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface
Parameters:
whichAtom - ATOM1 or ATOM2 or NEIGHBOR
Returns:
x coordinate of the atom at the specified end of the bond

getY

public float getY(int whichAtom)
Gets the second coordinate of the atom at the specified end of the current bond. An undefined neighbor can also be queried (when the given parameter value is NEIGHBOR). This neighbouring atom is connected to either end of the bond. This is needed for 3D drawing.

Specified by:
getY in interface MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface
Parameters:
whichAtom - ATOM1 or ATOM2 or NEIGHBOR
Returns:
y coordinate of the atom at the specified end of the bond

getZ

public float getZ(int whichAtom)
Gets the third coordinate of the atom at the specified end of the current bond. An undefined neighbor can also be queried (when the given parameter value is NEIGHBOR). This neighbouring atom is connected to either end of the bond. This is needed for 3D drawing.

Specified by:
getZ in interface MoleculeIterators.BondIteratorInterface
Parameters:
whichAtom - ATOM1 or ATOM2 or NEIGHBOR
Returns:
z coordinate of the atom at the specified end of the bond
